2025-05-16: A shrimp’s heart is in its head.
2025-05-18: Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren’t.
2025-05-19: Honey never spoils. 3,000-year-old honey is still edible.
2025-05-20: There’s enough DNA in your body to stretch from the sun to Pluto and back — 17 times.
2025-05-22: Scotland’s national animal is the unicorn.
2025-05-23: A group of flamingos is called a ‘flamboyance’.
2025-05-24: An eagle can kill a young deer and fly away with it.
2025-05-25: Cows have best friends and get stressed when separated.
2025-05-26: There are more fake flamingos in the world than real ones.
2025-05-27: Sea otters hold hands while they sleep so they don’t drift apart.
2025-05-28: The Eiffel Tower can grow more than 6 inches in summer heat.
2025-05-29: Sloths can hold their breath longer than dolphins can.
2025-05-30: The longest hiccuping spree lasted 68 years.

2025-06-02: Turtles can breathe through their butts.
2025-06-03: The inventor of the Pringles can is buried in one.
2025-06-05: Humans share about 60% of their DNA with bananas.
2025-06-06: Ants can survive in a microwave.
2025-06-07: Some cats are allergic to humans.
2025-06-08: You can’t hum while holding your nose.
2025-06-10: Pineapples were so rare in the 1700s, people rented them for parties.
2025-06-11: The majority of your brain is fat.
2025-06-12: There's a basketball court on the top floor of the US Supreme Court building.
2025-06-14: You are about 1cm taller in the morning than in the evening.
